sections.EXECUTION:
This drill can be shot in body armor or not. The shooter will load ammunition as prescribed above and move to the start position (triangle) facing down range. Starting position will be in the collapsed low ready (rifle) or hands relaxed off weapon (pistol). On buzzer, shooter will rapidly acquire first target. The shooter will fire one round per target in ascending order while transitioning to target one in-between each target. (Target Sequence: T1, T2, T1, T3, T1, T4, T1, T5, T1, T4, T1, T3, T1, T2, T1) This drill can be executed from right to left or left to right. Standard: Non-Standard target: Recommended is to keep all rounds within the A-Zone for rifle rounds and C-Zone for Pistol Standard target: 6”x6” acceptable zone for rifle and 8”x8” acceptable sone for pistol. *Kill zones should be centered on the upper thoracic area to ensure lethal objectives are met.*
Stress Shoot Overlay
NARATIVE:
Soldiers will begin the stress shoot by conducting various exercises behind the firing line. Shooters will move to the first firing point where a safety will hand them a load magazine. Shooters will lock and load their weapon and begin their iteration. Soldiers will only shoot in pre-determined areas and engage targets within the range fans. At the final firing point soldiers will engage targets between 300m-400m.

Phase III: Begins with consolidation and accountability of all SMs and equipment and ends with movement at 3/2 Motor pool. Critical to this phase is the final AAR and accountability of MWE.
